article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13054 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: This is an opportunity for your son to join the “Raider Top Gun Shot Club.” This program provides an opportunity for your son to become more active and to improve upon his basketball skills. This program runs from April 27st to August 31st.

Here is how you become a member of the “Raider Top Gun Shot Club”:
• Grades 1-6: Make 5,000 shots (41 makes a day)
• Grades 7-12: Make 8,000 shots (65 makes a day)

p.em: Go by what grade you’ll be in next year for the 2020–2021 school year

div.p: For more information and a record sheet, see the following documents…

p.a: SHOT TRACKER 2020 (Print to keep track of Shots Made)

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13047 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: Lakota Elementary Countdown to Summer Calendar

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13043 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Today, Governor DeWine announced we will not be returning to school and we will complete the school year through distance learning. First, I would like to thank our students and parents for their support and hard work at home. Next, I would like to thank our teachers who were given little notice to prepare for distance learning. Our teachers have done a wonderful job of preparing and working with our students to ensure education continues. I also want to recognize and thank our cafeteria staff who have continued to prepare meals for our students. The entire Lakota School staff has worked in a variety of ways to make the best of a difficult situation.

I am asking that we continue to work and push to the finish of the school year. Communication with your child’s teachers is a key to continuing education. Continue to check Progressbook and Google Classroom for assignment updates. We are continuing to discuss how we will handle the 4th quarter grades, semester grades, and year long grades for courses. We understand this quarter is different and we plan to handle grades in a fair manner that does not penalize our students.
The next packet drop off and pick up day will be April 30 and May 1 from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM. Please check with your teachers regarding work expectations and what needs to be submitted.

On behalf of the entire staff, our hearts go out to our seniors. We are working to find ways to honor our seniors while maintaining the safety of everyone. We have reached out to our seniors today, through email, for their ideas and suggestions. Parents, please include your suggestions with the student’s responses. Our hope is to have some type of Commencement ceremony on May 31, 2020. We will work with the County Health Department to make sure everyone is safe while recognizing our seniors as best we can. We will also look for ways to recognize our seniors in the summer or fall, once the current restrictions are lifted.
On behalf of the entire staff, we miss our students. Please continue to check your email and Lakota web page for updates as we work to close out the school year.
Stay positive and healthy.
Sincerely,
Chad Coffman, Superintendent

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13040 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: Lakota will Light up the Night for our Seniors!!

div.p: In honor of the Senior Class of 2020, tonight (Monday), April 20th at 8:20 pm, Lakota Local Schools, along with the Sandusky Bay Conference and many other Northwest Ohio schools, will light up our stadium lights for 20 minutes. At 8:20 pm, (20:20 military time), we invite Lakota residents to join us and turn on their porch lights to recognize the Lakota Senior Class of 2020.
The stadium and parking lot will be closed. We welcome you to drive by the school.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13037 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Dear Lakota Families,

Free Internet Update: Thank you to Amplex for providing free WiFi at the First Church of God in Risingsun. The name of the network is “Amplex Free Wifi.” It is directed towards the North parking lot and you do not need a password to access. A special “thank you” to Pastor Paul Rutledge for permitting Amplex to install the WiFi on the church property.
Students, please remember to follow these guidelines when using Lakota Local Schools and First Church of God Internet:

li.p: Follow all social distancing expectations and stay in your own vehicles when on the school or church property.
The parking lots will be closed at 9:00 PM.
Be respectful of the property and each other.
Students in grades K-8 are to be accompanied by an adult when visiting these locations.

div.p: In addition to the free internet locations listed in Monday’s email, our students in Seneca County have free WiFi access at the PJ Brickhouse restaurant parking lot in Bascom.
We are working with a number of providers in hopes of establishing additional WiFi access locations.
Sincerely,
Chad Coffman, Superintendent

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13018 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Dear Lakota Families,

I hope you enjoyed the Easter break. Thank you for your continued support of your child’s education from home. Also, thank you for dropping off completed work last week. Please continue to check Progressbook and Google classroom for assignments.

Free Internet: Free internet is now available in the Lakota school’s parking lot in the area between the board office and the stadium press box. The name of the network is “LakotaParkingLotWiFi” and there is no password required to connect. In addition, We are working with Amplex to provide free internet in Risingsun. I will send another email once it is available. The following are additional free wifi locations outside of the district:

li.p: Elmore public parking lots near the post office and park
Luckey Library – park across street for best reception
April 14 – Breakfast/ Lunch pick up – 4 meals
April 20 – Breakfast/ Lunch pick up – 5 meals
April 27 – Breakfast/ Lunch pick up – 5 meals

div.p: Please email Michelle Guzman at mguzman@lakotaschools.org by 9:00 AM to place your request. Breakfast/ lunch orders may be picked up from 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM in the front drop off circle. One person may pick up for a family. Please let Michelle know if you are a regular pick up and do not plan to participate on any day.
The April board meeting is cancelled. The next scheduled board meeting is May 18, 2020.
We will get through this. Stay positive and healthy!
Sincerely,
Chad Coffman, Superintendent

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13012 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Notice is hereby given that the Lakota Local School District Board of Education will not meet in Regular Session on Monday, April 20, 2020 as previously planned. The next scheduled Regular Session Board Meeting will be held on Monday, May 18, 2020 in the Staff Dining Room at Lakota Local Schools at 5200 CR 13, Kansas, OH 44841.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-13003 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Congratulations to Josie Bear!

figure.figcaption: Josie Bear — Student of the Month for April

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12958 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Attention parents and students of any School District in the State of Ohio wishing to attend Lakota Local School District tuition free. Lakota will once again participate in OPEN ENROLLMENT. Anyone wishing to participate in this program may apply online at www.lakotaschools.org on the district homepage. (The link will be available April 1st.)
In addition to a completed online application, you must provide a proof of residency, such as a utility bill that can be scanned and emailed directly to klee@lakotaschools.org.
Non-resident students can make application to attend the Lakota Local School District at no cost.

Applications will be accepted from April 1st at 8:00 a.m. thru April 30, 2020. Any student wishing more information on the Open Enrollment process may call the district office at 419-986-6650 Ext. 4302.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12899 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

p.span: At this time every year, we begin to schedule classes for the next school year. In the next few days, students will be receiving two emails. One email will be sent from lbiddle@lakotaschools.org which will include instructions and login information for students to request courses for next year. All schedule requests should be completed by Wednesday, April 1, 2020. The second email will be sent from ssprow@lakotaschools.org. This email will contain a google form for students to complete to indicate their future plans after high school. Both of these processes are very important for students to complete for the planning of next school year. Any question should be emailed to lbiddle@lakotaschools.org.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12880 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: Kindergarten Screening for April has been Postponed

div.p: Dear Parents/Guardians:

Unfortunately, due to the restrictions put in place by the Governor of Ohio, we will need to cancel our April 2nd and April 3rd Kindergarten Screenings. Since we are uncertain as to when we will be able to return to school, new screening dates have not been set at this time. We will contact families as soon as we reschedule in order to proceed with the registration process. Should you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact me at 419-986-6640, Ext. 5102 or by email at dward@lakotaschools.org.
Sincerely,
Dana Ward, Elementary Principal

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12864 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general
blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12755 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Information about the Fall Washington D.C. Trip for 8th Grade Students can be found on the website in the Middle School Menu.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12730 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general
blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12668 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: We have a limited number of spots open for children to attend our preschool program. This year’s preschool will be full day preschool, 2 days a week (Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday). The cost is $125.00 per month. If you are interested in your son/daughter attending our preschool please complete the online enrollment on the district webpage.

This enrollment will be available from February 20th at 8 a.m. until March 20th at 8 a.m.. Enrollment does not guarantee your child a spot. Priority admission will be given to Lakota residents, and students who are eligible for kindergarten the following year (2021-22). Proof of residency may be requested. Notifications will be mailed on April 15th and information packets will need to be turned back in by May 6th.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12643 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: High School Yearbooks Available for Pre-Sale…

div.p: The Lakota 2019-2020 Yearbook is available for pre-sale.
The books can be pre-ordered from now until Friday, May 22nd.

To order online (with a credit or debit card), log on to our secure website: www.yearbookordercenter.com. Order # 13819.
OR
To pay with cash or check, fill out a form and return with payment to Miss Holbrook.
Yearbooks will be sold on a first come first serve

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12606 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: If you have a child who will be five years of age before August 1st of this year, he/she is eligible to attend Kindergarten.
Kindergarten screening has been postponed.

a.class: wp-block-button wp-block-button__link is-style-fill has-very-light-gray-color has-text-color has-background

div.p: **Note: Preschool registration does not use FinalForms and is a separate process that will be shared with parents and community members soon. Registering your preschooler using the above link will not register them in the district for preschool.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12558 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: Lakota Students and Staff Get Free Microsoft Office

div.p: Lakota is proud to offer our students and staff free access to full versions of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other Microsoft Office products on their personal devices. To learn how to download your free copy of Microsoft Office, please follow the attached instructions.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12292 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

h2.a: Scheduling an Activity and/or Using Lakota Facilities…

div.p: We have now gone paperless for scheduling an activity/use of the facility. Please do not use the paper copies anymore. The link is under 3 different locations on our website. It is under teacher/staff, and Facilities on the right hand side of the web page. It is also under staff – activity/fundraiser forms. Please click on the link and fill out the form and then hit submit. You will receive confirmation through email once the process has been completed.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-12133 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general
blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-8707 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

p.span: Dear Parents/Guardians of Lakota Local Schools,
We believe it is important to communicate with our families. One way we do that is with our instant message system. We are using a company called

The phone numbers and emails that will be used initially are the contacts listed in our student information system. If you would like to be able to change how you are contacted please contact your child’s school office.

article.class: blog-post-side-layout no-featured-image post-10983 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-general

div.p: Once again, the Lakota Schools will be collecting markers for recycling as part of the Crayola ColorCycle program. In the past two years, we as a district have sent in over 7,000 markers to be recycled! That is 7,000 we have kept out of our landfills! Our collection drive will run through the end of the school year. All forms and brands of markers will be accepted – including dry erase, permanent, and highlighters. Please send in your old markers with your child or drop off at your building’s office. We will have collection bins located throughout the buildings. If you have any questions, please contact Mrs. Melissa Renfro at mrenfro@lakotaschools.org.
Thank you for your help!
